Class SimplePOI

java.lang.Object
  pt.com.gmv.lab.implant.rendering.poi.SimplePOI
All Implemented Interfaces:
POIModel
public class SimplePOI
extends Object
implements POIModel

A simple POI to be exhibited on screen with an accompanying text representation

2
Author:
fao

getPOILocation

public WorldVector getPOILocation()
Description copied from interface: POIModel
Returns the POI location on the world. It's not equal to the GPS location of the point, since these values represent a distance to the actual device location.

Specified by:
getPOILocation in interface POIModel
Returns:
A vector containing the world location of the POI to the device.

draw

public void draw(Canvas canvas,
                 Paint paint)
Draws the model on screen. The text block is created if there isn't one and the model is drawn on screen, taking into account the screen coordinates.

Specified by:
draw in interface POIModel
Parameters:
canvas - The canvas where to draw
paint - The Paint object to use in the drawing routine
See Also:
drawPOI(Canvas, Paint, float)

drawPOI

protected void drawPOI(Canvas canvas,
                       Paint paint,
                       float maxHeight)
Override to customize the drawing routine of a POI This implementation draws a hollow circle in dark red color, with variable height, depending on the fact that the model is centered in the screen

Parameters:
canvas - The canvas where to draw the POI
paint - The paint object used in the drawing
maxHeight - Text and model maxheight

update

public void update(Location current)
Updated the screen location based on the current device location. The update is done taking into account the current screen location.

Specified by:
update in interface POIModel
Parameters:
current - The Location object containing the device coordinates.
See Also:
pt.com.gmv.lab.implant.rendering.poi.POI#update(android.location.Location)

performWorldTransformations

public void performWorldTransformations(ProjectionCamera mCamera)
Performs a set of transformations to the position vectors. The rotation matrix is applied to the screen location vector. With a call to this method, the model gets positioned on screen, according to the device orientation.

Specified by:
performWorldTransformations in interface POIModel
Parameters:
mCamera - The camera used to help apply the transformations
See Also:
pt.com.gmv.lab.implant.rendering.poi.POI#performWorldTransformations(pt.com.gmv.lab.implant.rendering.poi.util.ProjectionCamera)
